DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS built environment
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS built environment
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Host inoculation
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details on experimental inoculation of animal species.

FIELD.LABEL: number of inoculated individuals
FIELD.NAME: number of inoculated individuals
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of host individuals inoculated for the experiment.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics: ecosystem
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: ecosystem and relationships ( Organism characteristics got too big)

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object.

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection: methods, storage and transport
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: sample collection: methods, storage and transport (sample collection became unmanageable)

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms: study or project

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Human surveillance data
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information associated with a human influenza surveillance sample.

FIELD.LABEL: frequency of cooking
FIELD.NAME: frequency of cooking
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of times a meal is cooked per week

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[12][0-9]{3}(-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?(/[0-9]{4}(-[0-9]{2}(-[0-9]{2}(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?)?$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ([+-]?(0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: sampling time outside
FIELD.NAME: sampling time outside
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The recent and long term history of outside sampling

FIELD.LABEL: temperature outside house
FIELD.NAME: temperature outside house
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The recorded temperature value at sampling time outside

FIELD.LABEL: train station collection location
FIELD.NAME: train station collection location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The train station collection location

FIELD.LABEL: train stop collection location
FIELD.NAME: train stop collection location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The train stop collection location

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: internal environment

FIELD.LABEL: surface material
FIELD.NAME: surface material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: surface materials at the point of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: surface-air contaminant
FIELD.NAME: surface-air contaminant
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: contaminant identified on surface

FIELD.LABEL: indoor surface
FIELD.NAME: indoor surface
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of indoor surface

FIELD.LABEL: indoor space
FIELD.NAME: indoor space
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

FIELD.LABEL: filter type
FIELD.NAME: filter type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants

FIELD.LABEL: heating and cooling system type
FIELD.NAME: heating and cooling system type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: methods of conditioning or heating a room or building

FIELD.LABEL: substructure type
FIELD.NAME: substructure type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level

FIELD.LABEL: light type
FIELD.NAME: light type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light

FIELD.LABEL: building setting
FIELD.NAME: building setting
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a location (geography) where a building is set

FIELD.LABEL: building occupancy type
FIELD.NAME: building occupancy type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used

FIELD.LABEL: space typical state
FIELD.NAME: space typical state
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: customary or normal state of the space

FIELD.LABEL: typical occupant density
FIELD.NAME: typical occupant density
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: customary or normal density of occupants

FIELD.LABEL: occupancy at sampling
FIELD.NAME: occupancy at sampling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space

FIELD.LABEL: occupant density at sampling
FIELD.NAME: occupant density at sampling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage

FIELD.LABEL: ventilation type
FIELD.NAME: ventilation type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The intentional movement of air from outside a building to the inside through forced or natural movement of air

FIELD.LABEL: rooms that are on the same hallway
FIELD.NAME: rooms that are on the same hallway
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of room(s) (room number, room name) located in the same hallway as sampling room

FIELD.LABEL: wall surface treatment
FIELD.NAME: wall surface treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The surface treatment of interior wall

FIELD.LABEL: wall area
FIELD.NAME: wall area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total area of the sampled room's walls

FIELD.LABEL: elevator count
FIELD.NAME: elevator count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of elevators within the built structure

FIELD.LABEL: floor area
FIELD.NAME: floor area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The area of the floor space within the room

FIELD.LABEL: furniture
FIELD.NAME: furniture
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The types of furniture present in the sampled room

FIELD.LABEL: water feature type
FIELD.NAME: water feature type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of water feature present within the building being sampled

FIELD.LABEL: room door distance
FIELD.NAME: room door distance
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Distance between doors (meters) in the hallway between the sampling room and adjacent rooms

FIELD.LABEL: room type
FIELD.NAME: room type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The main purpose or activity of the sampling room. A room is any distinguishable space within a structure

FIELD.LABEL: window location
FIELD.NAME: window location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The relative location of the window within the room

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling type
FIELD.NAME: ceiling type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of ceiling according to the ceiling's appearance or construction

FIELD.LABEL: door direction of opening
FIELD.NAME: door direction of opening
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The direction the door opens

FIELD.LABEL: exposed pipes
FIELD.NAME: exposed pipes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of exposed pipes in the room

FIELD.LABEL: wall height
FIELD.NAME: wall height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average height of the walls in the sampled room

FIELD.LABEL: door type, metal
FIELD.NAME: door type, metal
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of metal door

FIELD.LABEL: inside lux light
FIELD.NAME: inside lux light
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The recorded value at sampling time (power density)

FIELD.LABEL: exposed ductwork
FIELD.NAME: exposed ductwork
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The amount of exposed ductwork in the room

FIELD.LABEL: door material
FIELD.NAME: door material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The material the door is composed of

FIELD.LABEL: adjacent rooms
FIELD.NAME: adjacent rooms
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of rooms (room number, room name) immediately adjacent to the sampling room

FIELD.LABEL: wall thermal mass
FIELD.NAME: wall thermal mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ability of the wall to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete or concrete block that is either exposed or covered only with paint

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling signs of water/mold
FIELD.NAME: ceiling signs of water/mold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the ceiling

FIELD.LABEL: window status
FIELD.NAME: window status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Defines whether the windows were open or closed during environmental testing

FIELD.LABEL: door location
FIELD.NAME: door location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The relative location of the door in the room

FIELD.LABEL: window signs of water/mold
FIELD.NAME: window signs of water/mold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the window.

FIELD.LABEL: window type
FIELD.NAME: window type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of windows

FIELD.LABEL: window material
FIELD.NAME: window material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of material used to finish a window

FIELD.LABEL: window horizontal position
FIELD.NAME: window horizontal position
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The horizontal position of the window on the wall

FIELD.LABEL: room condition
FIELD.NAME: room condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The condition of the room at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: window area/size
FIELD.NAME: window area/size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The window's length and width

FIELD.LABEL: sampling floor
FIELD.NAME: sampling floor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located

FIELD.LABEL: room count
FIELD.NAME: room count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total count of rooms in the built structure including all room types

FIELD.LABEL: average daily occupancy
FIELD.NAME: average daily occupancy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Daily average occupancy of room. Indicate the number of person(s) daily occupying the sampling room.

FIELD.LABEL: floor condition
FIELD.NAME: floor condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The physical condition of the floor at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas

FIELD.LABEL: door type, wood
FIELD.NAME: door type, wood
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of wood door

FIELD.LABEL: door condition
FIELD.NAME: door condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The physical condition of the door

FIELD.LABEL: door movement
FIELD.NAME: door movement
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of movement of the door

FIELD.LABEL: interior wall condition
FIELD.NAME: interior wall condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The physical condition of the wall at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas

FIELD.LABEL: floor signs of water/mold
FIELD.NAME: floor signs of water/mold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew in a room

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling structure
FIELD.NAME: ceiling structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The construction format of the ceiling

FIELD.LABEL: wall texture
FIELD.NAME: wall texture
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a wall surface

FIELD.LABEL: floor thermal mass
FIELD.NAME: floor thermal mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ability of the floor to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations

FIELD.LABEL: room air exchange rate
FIELD.NAME: room air exchange rate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The rate at which outside air replaces indoor air in a given space

FIELD.LABEL: bathroom count
FIELD.NAME: bathroom count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of bathrooms in the building

FIELD.LABEL: shading device signs of water/mold
FIELD.NAME: shading device signs of water/mold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the shading device

FIELD.LABEL: window covering
FIELD.NAME: window covering
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of window covering

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling texture
FIELD.NAME: ceiling texture
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a ceiling surface

FIELD.LABEL: maximum occupancy
FIELD.NAME: maximum occupancy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The maximum amount of people allowed in the indoor environment

FIELD.LABEL: gender of restroom
FIELD.NAME: gender of restroom
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The gender type of the restroom

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling condition
FIELD.NAME: ceiling condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The physical condition of the ceiling at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas

FIELD.LABEL: floor structure
FIELD.NAME: floor structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the structural elements and subfloor upon which the finish flooring is installed

FIELD.LABEL: rooms that share a wall with sampling room
FIELD.NAME: rooms that share a wall with sampling room
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a wall with the sampling room

FIELD.LABEL: wall finish material
FIELD.NAME: wall finish material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The material utilized to finish the outer most layer of the wall

FIELD.LABEL: room occupancy
FIELD.NAME: room occupancy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Count of room occupancy at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: room location in building
FIELD.NAME: room location in building
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The position of the room within the building

FIELD.LABEL: floor finish material
FIELD.NAME: floor finish material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The floor covering type; the finished surface that is walked on

FIELD.LABEL: room window count
FIELD.NAME: room window count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of windows in the room

FIELD.LABEL: sampling room id or name
FIELD.NAME: sampling room id or name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction (fresh/frozen/other).

FIELD.LABEL: height carpet fiber mat
FIELD.NAME: height carpet fiber mat
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average carpet fiber height in the indoor environment

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling area
FIELD.NAME: ceiling area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The area of the ceiling space within the room

FIELD.LABEL: heating system delivery method
FIELD.NAME: heating system delivery method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method by which the heat is delivered through the system

FIELD.LABEL: room sampling position
FIELD.NAME: room sampling position
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The horizontal sampling position in the room relative to architectural elements

FIELD.LABEL: room moisture damage or mold history
FIELD.NAME: room moisture damage or mold history
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The history of moisture damage or mold in the past 12 months. Number of events of moisture damage or mold observed

FIELD.LABEL: door signs of water/mold
FIELD.NAME: door signs of water/mold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a door

FIELD.LABEL: room net area
FIELD.NAME: room net area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The net floor area of sampling room. Net area excludes wall thicknesses

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling thermal mass
FIELD.NAME: ceiling thermal mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ability of the ceiling to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete that is exposed. A metal deck that supports a concrete slab will act thermally as long as it is exposed to room air flow

FIELD.LABEL: rooms that share a door with sampling room
FIELD.NAME: rooms that share a door with sampling room
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a door with the sampling room

FIELD.LABEL: orientations of exterior window
FIELD.NAME: orientations of exterior window
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The compass direction the exterior window of the room is facing

FIELD.LABEL: wall location
FIELD.NAME: wall location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The relative location of the wall within the room

FIELD.LABEL: room volume
FIELD.NAME: room volume
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume of sampling room

FIELD.LABEL: door type, composite
FIELD.NAME: door type, composite
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The composite type of the door

FIELD.LABEL: bedroom count
FIELD.NAME: bedroom count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of bedrooms in the building

FIELD.LABEL: wall construction type
FIELD.NAME: wall construction type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The building class of the wall defined by the composition of the building elements and fire-resistance rating.

FIELD.LABEL: wall signs of water/mold
FIELD.NAME: wall signs of water/mold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a wall

FIELD.LABEL: window condition
FIELD.NAME: window condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The physical condition of the window at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: escalator count
FIELD.NAME: escalator count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of escalators within the built structure

FIELD.LABEL: cooling system identifier
FIELD.NAME: cooling system identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The cooling system identifier

FIELD.LABEL: quadrant position
FIELD.NAME: quadrant position
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The quadrant position of the sampling room within the building

FIELD.LABEL: number of pets
FIELD.NAME: number of pets
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of pets residing in the sampled space

FIELD.LABEL: window vertical position
FIELD.NAME: window vertical position
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical position of the window on the wall

FIELD.LABEL: fireplace type
FIELD.NAME: fireplace type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A firebox with chimney

FIELD.LABEL: heating delivery locations
FIELD.NAME: heating delivery locations
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The location of heat delivery within the room

FIELD.LABEL: ceiling finish material
FIELD.NAME: ceiling finish material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of material used to finish a ceiling

FIELD.LABEL: door type
FIELD.NAME: door type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of door material

FIELD.LABEL: number of houseplants
FIELD.NAME: number of houseplants
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of plant(s) in the sampling space

FIELD.LABEL: floor age
FIELD.NAME: floor age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time period since instalment of the carpet or flooring

FIELD.LABEL: rooms connected by a doorway
FIELD.NAME: rooms connected by a doorway
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of rooms connected to the sampling room by a doorway

FIELD.LABEL: specifications
FIELD.NAME: specifications
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The building specifications. If design is chosen, indicate phase: conceptual, schematic, design development, construction documents

FIELD.LABEL: specific humidity
FIELD.NAME: specific humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The mass of water vapour in a unit mass of moist air, usually expressed as grams of vapour per kilogram of air, or, in air conditioning, as grains per pound.

FIELD.LABEL: window open frequency
FIELD.NAME: window open frequency
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of times windows are opened per week

FIELD.LABEL: room dimensions
FIELD.NAME: room dimensions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The length, width and height of sampling room

FIELD.LABEL: water feature size
FIELD.NAME: water feature size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The size of the water feature

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: sample size sorting method
FIELD.NAME: sample size sorting method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: method by which samples are sorted

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: unusual properties

FIELD.LABEL: mechanical structure
FIELD.NAME: mechanical structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: mechanical structure: a moving structure

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: handidness
FIELD.NAME: handidness
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The handidness of the individual sampled

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: relative air humidity
FIELD.NAME: relative air humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air

FIELD.LABEL: absolute air humidity
FIELD.NAME: absolute air humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture

FIELD.LABEL: surface humidity
FIELD.NAME: surface humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: surface water activity as a function of air and material moisture

FIELD.LABEL: air temperature
FIELD.NAME: air temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the air at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: surface temperature
FIELD.NAME: surface temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the surface at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: surface moisture
FIELD.NAME: surface moisture
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: water held on the surface

FIELD.LABEL: surface moisture pH
FIELD.NAME: surface moisture pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of surface

FIELD.LABEL: dew point
FIELD.NAME: dew point
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: last time swept/mopped/vacuumed
FIELD.NAME: last time swept/mopped/vacuumed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The last time the floor was cleaned (swept, mopped, vacuumed)

FIELD.LABEL: number of residents
FIELD.NAME: number of residents
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of individuals currently occupying in the sampling location

FIELD.LABEL: average dew point
FIELD.NAME: average dew point
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average of dew point measures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

FIELD.LABEL: frequency of cleaning
FIELD.NAME: frequency of cleaning
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of times the sample location is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: carbon dioxide
FIELD.NAME: carbon dioxide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Pointer to physical material
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: References to sample or sample source material in physical resources

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment history

FIELD.LABEL: seasonal use
FIELD.NAME: seasonal use
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The seasons the space is occupied

FIELD.LABEL: season
FIELD.NAME: season
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).

FIELD.LABEL: average temperature
FIELD.NAME: average temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average of temperatures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: host specificity or range
FIELD.NAME: host specificity or range
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The range and diversity of host species that an organism is capable of infecting, defined by NCBI taxonomy identifier.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: treatment
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details of a treatment regime with a treatment agent.

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: experimental factor and block

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics: genetic
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: The genetic based characteristics of organisms (Organism characteristics field group became too large)

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD.LABEL: taxonomic classification
FIELD.NAME: taxonomic classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes. Expected values are: classification method, database name, and other parameters e.g. vConTACT vContact2 (references from NCBI RefSeq v83, genus rank classification, default parameters)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Reference

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample processing
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Any aspects collected about the processing of the sample once it has been collected. if the sample underwent cell lysis.

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Environmental information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Environmental information if not host associated.

FIELD.LABEL: date last rain
FIELD.NAME: date last rain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of the last time it rained

FIELD.LABEL: sampling day weather
FIELD.NAME: sampling day weather
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The weather on the sampling day

FIELD.LABEL: amount of light
FIELD.NAME: amount of light
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The unit of illuminance and luminous emittance, measuring luminous flux per unit area

FIELD.LABEL: train line
FIELD.NAME: train line
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The subway line name

FIELD.LABEL: outside relative humidity
FIELD.NAME: outside relative humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The recorded outside relative humidity value at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: building related
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: About parts of a building, that did not fit into internal environment

FIELD.LABEL: door area or size
FIELD.NAME: door area or size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The size of the door

FIELD.LABEL: visual media
FIELD.NAME: visual media
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The building visual media

FIELD.LABEL: built structure setting
FIELD.NAME: built structure setting
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The characterization of the location of the built structure as high or low human density

FIELD.LABEL: built structure type
FIELD.NAME: built structure type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A physical structure that is a body or assemblage of bodies in space to form a system capable of supporting loads

FIELD.LABEL: exterior door count
FIELD.NAME: exterior door count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of exterior doors in the built structure

FIELD.LABEL: design, construction, and operation documents
FIELD.NAME: design, construction, and operation documents
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The building design, construction and operation documents

FIELD.LABEL: shading device condition
FIELD.NAME: shading device condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The physical condition of the shading device at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: occupancy documentation
FIELD.NAME: occupancy documentation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of documentation of occupancy

FIELD.LABEL: floor count
FIELD.NAME: floor count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of floors in the building, including basements and mechanical penthouse

FIELD.LABEL: shading device material
FIELD.NAME: shading device material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The material the shading device is composed of

FIELD.LABEL: built structure age
FIELD.NAME: built structure age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The age of the built structure since construction

FIELD.LABEL: hallway/corridor count
FIELD.NAME: hallway/corridor count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total count of hallways and corridors in the built structure

FIELD.LABEL: architectural structure
FIELD.NAME: architectural structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An architectural structure is a human-made, free-standing, immobile outdoor construction

FIELD.LABEL: shading device type
FIELD.NAME: shading device type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of shading device

FIELD.LABEL: shading device location
FIELD.NAME: shading device location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The location of the shading device in relation to the built structure

FIELD.LABEL: drawings
FIELD.NAME: drawings
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The buildings architectural drawings; if design is chosen, indicate phase-conceptual, schematic, design development, and construction documents

FIELD.LABEL: address
FIELD.NAME: address
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The street name and building number where the sampling occurred.

FIELD.LABEL: room architectural elements
FIELD.NAME: room architectural elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The unique details and component parts that, together, form the architecture of a distinguishable space within a built structure

FIELD.LABEL: aerospace structure
FIELD.NAME: aerospace structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Aerospace structures typically consist of thin plates with stiffeners for the external surfaces, bulkheads and frames to support the shape and fasteners such as welds, rivets, screws and bolts to hold the components together
